context_of_use: This use case allows customers to place an order using selected items and multiple payment methods within the e-commerce platform.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to choose the most convenient payment option
description: This use case enables customers to checkout using multiple payment methods for their selected items.
preconditions: Customer has selected items in their shopping cart.
Customer is logged into their account.
postconditions: Payment is processed using the selected payment method.
assumptions: The customer has items in their shopping cart before initiating checkout.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
outstanding_issues: Clarification needed on the types of payment methods supported.
main_flow: 1. Customer initiates checkout → System displays the checkout page.
2. Customer selects payment method → System processes the selected payment method.
3. Customer confirms order → System places the order and sends confirmation.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the customer wants to manage their shopping cart, they can navigate to the cart management interface.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If payment processing fails, the system notifies the customer and prompts for a different payment method.
